dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: TikTok says 'in the process of restoring service' after going dark in US, citing Trump 'clarity'
News Content: TikTok said Sunday afternoon it was in the process of restoring service to its US users after going dark overnight when a new law banning the app took effect at midnight.

In a post on X Sunday afternoon, TikTok said, "In agreement with our service providers, TikTok is in the process of restoring service. We thank President Trump for providing the necessary clarity and assurance to our service providers that they will face no penalties providing TikTok to over 170 million Americans and allowing over 7 million small businesses to thrive."

In a social media post on Sunday, Trump asked tech companies to "not let TikTok stay dark" and reiterated his plan to issue a reprieve once he takes office.

"I will issue an executive order on Monday to extend the period of time before the law’s prohibitions take effect, so that we can make a deal to protect our national security,” Trump posted. “The order will also confirm that there will be no liability for any company that helped keep TikTok from going dark before my order."

TikTok's statement followed roughly two hours later.

Beginning late Saturday, US TikTok users were shown a message saying the app wasn't available, citing the new law.

The alert also mentioned Trump by name saying, "We are fortunate that President Trump has indicated that he will work with us on a solution to reinstate TikTok once he takes office."

On its website, TikTok told users they could still login to download their data. As of Sunday afternoon, that message had been updated to read: "We're working hard to resolve this issue. Thank you for your patience."TikTok went dark Saturday night, just ahead of a ban on Sunday. (Source: Yahoo Finance/Dan Howley)·Howley

Still, many on Capitol Hill — not to mention outside experts — questioned whether Trump will have the authority to make good on these promises.

Some of Trump’s closest political allies are also the most outspoken critics of TikTok, and have so far stood by the law that they passed last April with strong bipartisan margins.

In a statement early Sunday, Republican Sens. Tom Cotton and Pete Ricketts said, "now that the law has taken effect, there’s no legal basis for any kind of 'extension' of its effective date." Cotton added earlier this week on the Senate floor that "there will be no extension, no concession, and no compromises for TikTok."

Story Continues

House Speaker Mike Johnson, another top Trump ally, also raised questions Sunday, telling NBC he wanted to see the current law enforced and that he is "really heartened to see that Google and Apple and Microsoft have taken the steps to comply with the law."

The back-and-forth between Trump, TikTok, and US lawmakers will remain in acute relief on Monday, with TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew expected to be in attendance at inauguration events.

Rolling shutdown

Access to TikTok began getting cut off for some US users about 90 minutes before the new law took effect late Saturday. The app was also unavailable via Apple's App Store in the hours leading up to midnight. Videos intermittently loaded on TikTok for a time, but the app also showed a blacked-out screen indicating network issues.

Saturday night's rolling cutoff for US TikTok users followed a report from The Information which said Oracle (ORCL), which manages TikTok's US servers, was set to begin shutting down servers that host TikTok's data as early as 9:00 p.m. ET.

The law that has resulted in TikTok's shutdown doesn't outright ban the app, but rather it prohibits users from accessing the platform through app stores, like those run by Apple (AAPL) and Google (GOOG, GOOGL), and cloud services unless parent company ByteDance sells itself to an owner that is not controlled by a country the US considers adversarial.

Congress has accused ByteDance of having close ties to the Chinese government and alleges that the Chinese Communist Party could force the company to provide it with information on US users or otherwise spread propaganda on the platform.

But the outcry from users and TikTok's backers forced President Joe Biden and Trump to respond. Even with Trump's assurances Apple and Google that his administration won't enforce the law, it's not guaranteed that his — or any other administration — would do so in the future. Each time the companies don't comply with the law they'd have to pay a fine of $5,000 each time a user accesses the social media app.

Trump will have to either convince Congress to overturn the ban or find some other way to work around it if he wants to keep the service up and running, and neither of those is simple.

'It's a good thing for Meta'

Should TikTok's ban eventually come to pass, one of the biggest winners could be one of TikTok’s long-term critics: Meta (META) CEO Mark Zuckerberg. In particular, Instagram, owned by Meta, could see a sizable uptick in advertiser dollars if TikTok bites the dust.

“In general, it’s a good thing for Meta,” William Blair research analyst Ralph Schackart told Yahoo Finance. “We estimate in a note potentially 60% to 70% of TikTok spend could move to Instagram and it monetizes at around 3x the rate of TikTok.”

Social media companies have been chasing TikTok’s formula in an attempt to copy the social media platform’s success for some time. Reddit (RDDT), for example, offers its own short-form video feed that could entice former TikTok users looking for a broader kind of social media site complete with various message boards and communities.

Snapchat (SNAP) could also grab users who would have otherwise spent time on TikTok — and the advertising dollars that follow. But as Morgan Stanley managing director Brian Nowak points out, Snap would have to ensure it can keep those TikTok refugees coming back over and over again — as TikTok does — if it hopes to hold onto that ad revenue.

Pinterest (PINS) also stands to get a boost if TikTok is forced to go dark. While the app doesn’t have much in common with TikTok as far as overall design, it could offer an opportunity for online retailers looking to drum up e-commerce sales, something TikTok has managed to do thanks to its army of influencers.Sign up for Yahoo Finance's Week in Tech newsletter.·yahoofinance

With additional reporting from Ben Werschkul.

Alexis Keenan is a legal reporter for Yahoo Finance. Follow Alexis on X @alexiskweed.

Email Daniel Howley at dhowley@yahoofinance.com. Follow him on Twitter at @DanielHowley.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news regarding TikTok's temporary service disruption due to a new law could have mixed implications for Apple. On one hand, if TikTok remains banned, Apple could benefit from a shift in advertising revenue towards its App Store from other platforms like Meta and Snap. However, the uncertainty surrounding potential government actions and legal challenges creates risk that could weigh on investor confidence. Additionally, strong political statements from congressional leaders against TikTok may indicate a tough stance that could impact usership of apps available in the App Store, either positively or negatively depending on future developments. Overall, the balance of risks and opportunities suggests a moderate probability of price movement in both directions.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and potential market impacts from discussions and policies emerging from it, particularly concerning potential Trump policies (tariffs) and interest rates. Apple (AAPL) is mentioned indirectly as part of the "Magnificent 7," which are described as potentially 'top-heavy,' suggesting a possible correction. While AI and Crypto are also mentioned, those don't have as clear and direct of an effect on Apple's stock price. The overall tone is cautious due to uncertainties surrounding economic outlook, potential Trump tariffs, and the Fed's decisions. The article suggests potential volatility and mixed signals, making it slightly more probable that Apple's stock may experience a short-term pullback or stagnation given possible shifts in macroeconomic policy. The 'top-heavy' comment and macroeconomic uncertainty weigh negatively, while AI growth is already largely priced into the stock.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news article, "What Is the Nasdaq Composite Index?", is completely irrelevant to Apple Inc.  The article provides a definition of a market index, not any news that would directly impact Apple's stock price. Therefore, the news is unlikely to cause any significant movement in the Apple stock price. Any price change would be attributable to other market forces and not this news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including technology, banking, retail, and crypto. For Apple Inc. (AAPL), the article does not provide direct information or specific catalysts that would immediately affect its stock price. However, the broader themes discussed—such as AI advancements, potential tariffs, and market sentiment—could indirectly influence AAPL. Given Apple's position as a 'Magnificent 7' stock and its exposure to global markets, any negative sentiment around tariffs or market volatility could pose risks. Conversely, positive developments in AI or strong earnings season performance could benefit AAPL. The lack of direct AAPL-specific news suggests a neutral to slightly positive bias, but with significant uncertainty due to macroeconomic and political factors.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news about TikTok returning after Trump's comments does not have a direct impact on Apple Inc. (AAPL). TikTok's situation and Apple's stock price are not closely related in this context. Therefore, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling due to this specific news are relatively low. The news is more relevant to TikTok and social media sectors rather than Apple directly.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The provided news headline and content do not contain any information specific to Apple Inc. (AAPL) that could be used to estimate the probability of the stock price rising or falling. The news appears to be about upcoming IPOs in 2025, which is unrelated to Apple's current stock performance. Therefore, it is unlikely that this news would have a significant impact on Apple's stock price. As a result, the probability of the stock price rising or falling due to this news is estimated to be low.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The financial news discusses a potential rollback on the ban of TikTok in the US, as a result of President Trump's directive to allow service providers to avoid penalties if they continue supporting TikTok. This could positively influence investor sentiment towards Apple Inc., as they are one of the key platform providers for TikTok. However, there is uncertainty because several high-ranking officials have stated their opposition, suggesting future challenges might arise. On the other hand, if TikTok remains banned, competitors like Meta may benefit, which could indirectly impact Apple's positioning in the market.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news about TikTok indicates a potential temporary lifting of the ban, which could positively influence investor sentiment towards Apple since it plays a significant role in facilitating app distribution. This might lead to a belief that advertising revenue may continue to flow through Apple's app ecosystem rather than shifting to competitors like Meta if TikTok can remain operational. However, uncertainty remains regarding the enforcement of the law and the political landscape, which could pose risks. Considering the mixed signals and overall context, I predict a slightly higher probability of stock price rise compared to fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and potential market impacts from discussions and policies, particularly those related to Trump, tariffs, interest rates, AI, and crypto. Apple is mentioned as part of the "Magnificent 7," which are considered potentially "top-heavy," hinting at a possible correction. The article suggests volatility ahead of earnings season, with CEOs trying to 'talk up their businesses' during potentially 'rockier markets'. The overall sentiment is somewhat mixed, with both positive and negative catalysts at play. Tariffs and interest rates could negatively impact Apple, though potential AI advancements and CEO sentiment could balance things out. Considering previous predictions leaned towards a slight fall due to the "top-heavy" assessment, I will slightly adjust the probabilities here. The general uncertainty and potential for market volatility associated with the issues discussed at Davos is enough to lean slightly negative on the stock.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The provided news headline, "What Is the Nasdaq Composite Index?", is completely irrelevant to Apple Inc. However, given the nature of the news, which does not introduce any new risks or positive catalysts specifically for Apple, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling due to this news are low and relatively balanced.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news discusses the potential rollback on the ban of TikTok in the US due to President Trump's directive. This directive indicates a temporary resolution for the ongoing tension between TikTok and the US government. Since Apple Inc. operates the App Store, which is a key distribution channel for TikTok, the rollback could have a positive impact on investor sentiment towards Apple. Although there is still uncertainty due to opposition from high-ranking officials, the immediate response seems to be a stabilizing factor for the stock price. On the other hand, the potential for future regulatory challenges means that the stock price may not experience a significant boost but could stabilize.

If TikTok can continue operating, Apple stands to benefit from the advertisement revenues that may flow through its App Store, rather than shifting to competitors like Meta. However, the political landscape remains tense, with opposing views among lawmakers suggesting the potential for future regulatory challenges. The mixed implications of this news lead to a balanced view, leaning slightly toward a positive outlook due to the immediate relief for TikTok, which could sustain Apple’s revenue streams. Based on this analysis, I assess a moderate probability for the stock price to rise, with some likelihood of it falling as uncertainty persists.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and highlights several factors that could influence market sentiment. }
